main event: Two observers spotted a bright, shiny, metallic, saucer-shaped object hovering and making a jerking motion over Elko, Nevada on August 20, 1953.
interesting points: The object appeared to be about 20-25 feet in diameter and was very bright, shiny, and metallic in nature.
The object was first observed almost directly overhead, then appeared to maneuver to the north and disappear from view.
The observation was made by two balloons, and the object startled the observers in its appearance and general maneuver of hovering and making a jerking motion.
The object was tracked for 1-2 minutes, but could have been followed for a much longer time if not for the need to track the balloon.
The elevation angle of the object was 25 to 35 degrees, and the azimuth was 213 to 238 degrees from the Elko airport.
